article.title: Identification of two new HMXBs in the LMC: a $âˆ¼$2013 s pulsar and a probable SFXT

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main difference between the X-ray light curves of XMMU J053108.3-690923 (left) and XMMU J053320.8-684122 (right)?
choices: XMMU J053108.3-690923 shows periodic bursts, while XMMU J053320.8-684122 shows a single, large flare.
XMMU J053108.3-690923 exhibits a constant luminosity, while XMMU J053320.8-684122 shows significant variability.
XMMU J053108.3-690923 is much brighter than XMMU J053320.8-684122 in the X-ray band.
XMMU J053108.3-690923 shows a gradual decrease in luminosity, while XMMU J053320.8-684122 shows a gradual increase.

multiple_choice_question.text: What information can be extracted from the peaks observed in the power density spectrum of XMMU J053108.3-690923 (left)?
choices: The peaks indicate the presence of a supergiant companion star.
The peaks correspond to the characteristic timescale of the SFXT phenomenon.
The peaks represent the orbital period of the binary system.
The peaks are related to the spin period of the neutron star and its harmonics.

multiple_choice_question.text: What spectral model best describes the X-ray data of XMMU J053108.3-690923?
choices: An absorbed power-law model with an additional black-body component.
A partial covering absorbed power-law model.

multiple_choice_question.text: What can be concluded about the mass of the donor star in XMMU J053108.3-690923 based on its position in the color-magnitude diagram?
choices: The donor star has a mass of approximately 8 solar masses.
The donor star has a mass in the range of 12-18 solar masses.
The donor star has a mass of approximately 22 solar masses.
The mass of the donor star cannot be determined from this diagram.
